item.title: git ssh REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED
item.description: Could not read from remote repository
item.content:encoded:

@    WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED!     @
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY!
Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)!
It is also possible that a host key has just been changed.
The fingerprint for the RSA key sent by the remote host is
SHA256:xxxxxxx.
Please contact your system administrator.
Add correct host key in /Users/xxx/.ssh/known_hosts to get rid of this message.
Offending RSA key in /Users/xxx/.ssh/known_hosts:1
Host key for github.com has changed and you have requested strict checking.
Host key verification failed.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.

Solution

item.title: error: git object file .git/objects/xxx is empty å’Œ fatal: cannot read existing object info
item.description: index-pack failedï¼Œunable to unlink null bad address
item.content:encoded:
object file ç›¸å…³é”™è¯¯

æœ¬åœ°çš„repoåœ¨æ‰§è¡Œgit logå’Œgit pullå‘½ä»¤æ—¶å‡ºç°äº†å¦‚ä¸‹å…³äºobject fileçš„é”™è¯¯ï¼š

git log é”™è¯¯

>>>> $ git log
error: object file .git/objects/7b/40exxx is empty
error: object file .git/objects/7b/40exxx is empty
fatal: loose object 7b40exxx (stored in .git/objects/7b/40exxx) is corrupt

git pull é”™è¯¯

>>>> $ git pull
error: object file .git/objects/7b/40exxx is empty
error: object file .git/objects/7b/40exxx is empty
remote: Counting objects: 479, done
remote: Finding sources: 100% (1388/1388)
error: object file .git/objects/7b/40exxx is empty
fatal: cannot read existing object info 40exxx
fatal: index-pack failed
warning: unable to unlink '(null)': Bad address

è§£å†³æ–¹æ³• Solution

1
2
3
4
5
6
7
8

cd <your_repo>

# å¤‡ä»½ .git
cp -r .git .git-bak

cd .git
find . -type f -empty -delete -print
git fsck --full
